title: 105_hr3732
content: The Act titled the "Rex Brewer Social Security Disability Fairness and Equity Act of 1998" eliminates the waiting period for Social Security Disability beneficiaries with terminal illnesses. The definition of terminal illness is provided in the Act. The "Rex Brewer Social Security Disability Fairness and Equity Act of 1998" eliminates the waiting period for Social Security Disability beneficiaries with terminal illnesses. The definition of terminal illness is a medically determinable physical impairment expected to result in death within six months. The amendments apply to benefits for applications filed after the enactment date. The "Rex Brewer Social Security Disability Fairness and Equity Act of 1998" eliminates the waiting period for Social Security Disability beneficiaries with terminal illnesses. The act also includes provisions regarding the prohibition against payment of Title II benefits to prisoners, requiring institutions to provide specific information to the Commissioner on a monthly basis. The "Rex Brewer Social Security Disability Fairness and Equity Act of 1998" requires institutions to provide specific information to the Commissioner on individuals confined in the institution for the purpose of carrying out paragraph (1). The Commissioner shall pay $400 to the institution for each individual whose benefit under this title ceases to be payable as a result of the application of this subsection. The "Rex Brewer Social Security Disability Fairness and Equity Act of 1998" mandates institutions to provide information to the Commissioner on confined individuals. The Commissioner will pay $400 to the institution for each individual whose benefits cease under this subsection. Additionally, institutions may receive $200 within 30 days or $100 if the information is provided within 90 days after an individual's confinement begins. No payment will be made if benefits are no longer payable to the individual. The agreement allows the Commissioner to transfer necessary funds from the Trust Funds to make payments to institutions for confined individuals. The Commissioner can also provide information to federal assistance programs for eligibility purposes on a reimbursable basis. The Act applies to individuals starting confinement after four months from enactment. Title II requirement for confinement stemming from a crime punishable by over 1 year is eliminated. Clause amendments specify criminal offenses without a specific sentence length. The Act eliminates the requirement for confinement due to a crime punishable by over 1 year and specifies criminal offenses without a specific sentence length. Amendments apply to individuals starting confinement after four months from enactment. The Act amends clauses regarding payment to institutions for inmate information and reduces title XVI payment by fifty percent in cases involving comparable title II payment. The Act amends payment clauses for institutions and reduces title XVI payments by fifty percent in cases involving comparable title II payments. The amendments made by this subsection shall apply as if included in the enactment of the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996. Additionally, there is an exemption from computer matching requirements under Section 552a(a)(8)(B) of title 5, United States Code. The Act includes amendments to payment clauses for institutions and reduces title XVI payments by fifty percent in cases with comparable title II payments. It also exempts computer matching requirements under Section 552a(a)(8)(B) of title 5, United States Code. Amendments are made to sections of the Social Security Act regarding matches performed pursuant to specific provisions. The amendments made by this subsection will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
